instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: At first there was no power on and there was no voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> i changed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> then now i have the <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> 0.9V, the logic powers on but there is no image.

CPU gets power?
Did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
If you have USB activity for sure, then check external video too.
If not present, bad GPU...

threads.message: I tried to replace the GPU but still the same problem, and i am sure that i have a good LCD.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: no, i tried but not at all

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Is not LCD issue, if also missing external video.
There must something related with GPU, or GMUX.
You can try hardware mod to disable GPU, just in case.
Supposing that you really have USB activity, not just steady light.
